1:
God, the all-powerful one, speaks;\q1 he summons all people,
\q2 from the east to the west.
\q1
2:
His glory shines from Mount Zion in Jerusalem,\q2 an extremely beautiful city.


\q
3:
Our God comes to us,\q2 and he is not silent.
\q1 A great fire is in front of him,
\q2 and a storm is around him.
\q1
4:
He comes to judge his people.\q1 He shouts to the angels in heaven
\q2 and to the people on the earth.
\q1
5:
He says, "Summon those who faithfully worship me,\q2 those who made a covenant with me by offering sacrifices to me."


\q
6:
The angels in heaven declare,\q2 "God is righteous,
\q2 and he is the supreme judge."



\q1
7:
God says, "My people, listen!\q2 You Israelite people, listen,
\q1 as I, your God, say what you have done that is wrong.
\q1
8:
I am not rebuking you for making sacrifices to me,\q2 for the offerings that you always burn on the altar for me.


\q1
9:
But I do not really need the bulls from your barns\q2 and the goats from your pens that you sacrifice,
\q1
10:
because all the animals in the forest belong to me,\q2 and all the cattle on a thousand hills also belong to me.
\q1
11:
I know and own all the birds in the mountains,\q2 and all the creatures that move around in the fields.


\q1
12:
So if I were hungry, I would not tell you to bring me some food\q2 because everything in the world belongs to me!
\q1
13:
I do not eat the flesh of the bulls that you sacrifice,\q2 and I do not drink the blood of the goats that you offer to me.


\q1
14:
The sacrifice that I really want is that you thank me\q2 and do all that you have promised to do.
\q1
15:
Pray to me when you have troubles.\q2 If you do that, I will rescue you, and then you will praise me.


\q1
16:
But I say this to the wicked people:\q1 Why do you recite my commandments
\q2 or talk about the covenant that I made with you?
\q1
17:
For you have refused to allow me to discipline you,\q2 and you have rejected what I told you to do.


\q1
18:
Every time that you see a thief, you become his friend,\q2 and you spend much time with those who commit adultery.
\q1
19:
You are always talking about doing wicked things,\q2 and you are always trying to deceive people.
\q1
20:
You are always accusing members of your own family\q2 and slandering them.


\q1
21:
You did all those things, and I did not say anything to you,\q2 so you thought that I was a sinner just like you.
\q1 But now I rebuke you and accuse you, right in front of you.
\q1
22:
So, all you who have ignored me, pay attention to this,\q1 because if you do not, I will tear you to pieces,
\q2 and there will be no one to rescue you.


\q
23: The sacrifice that truly honors me is to thank me for what I have done;\q2 and I will save those who always do the things that I want them to."
